posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked:
So I’m experimenting with CLion and building allwpilib from source.

In the notes for Cmake (and in the message for when the build fails) it mentions that I need to build OpenCV from source.

How do I go about doing this and which version should I use or is there an alternative approach? Also experimenting with building allwpilib from source with IntelliJ and (Gradle), and have no problems on that front.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
narmstro:

In the notes for Cmake (and in the message for when the build fails) it mentions that I need to build OpenCV from source.

You do not need to build OpenCV from source if you have system packages that provide it.  The document is admittedly a little confusingly worded, but I build just fine with cmake on Ubuntu 22.04 using the standard OpenCV 4 system dev+java packages.  The trickiest part of this is that the java package often is not automatically discovered by cmake, so you may have to find the OpenCV .jar file on your system and point cmake directly to it.

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: Working on a windows machine myself I’m assuming I would have to install open CV

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: On windows, you can use vcpkg.  We don’t have that documented, but have a github CI cmake windows build , so you can look at that for how to set things up (although we disable the Java parts of the build).

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked:
Thank you.  I have vcpkg installed and used it to install opencv.

Which file in allwpilib do I change to point Cmake to jar/cscore.jar?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You don’t change a file.  You set a cmake option; the easiest way to do this is to use either the cmake gui or the ccmake command, which will give you a text box with “NOTFOUND” in it to fill out.

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: It looks like CLion’s implementation of cmake doesn’t have cmake-gui or ccmake

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked:
Okay.  I think I managed to find the OpenCV.jar file I needed from the windows installation.

I also managed to point CLion to it.

Building in CLion crashes due to warnings as errors.

EDIT:  I think I’m going to just stick to ./gradlew build.
